lines.text:
[to the maid]
Essie... Essie... Your eyelids are growing heavy You will sleep... sleep.
[Mina opens a door, and goes inside]
Mina... you are in the closet. Open the door, and come out.
Now walk to the Terrace Door. Watch out for the foot...
[too late! Mina trips over the footstool, and goes flying]
You walk to the Terrace Door and you go back to sleep! *Watch out!*
[Essie and Mina bump into one another and fall to the floor. Dracula throws his arms in frustration]
[Dracula is hypnotizing a valet at the theatre where Doctor Seward is enjoying an opera]
You vill tell Doctor Seward there is a message for him in the lobby... and you will remember nothing of what I tell you.
[the valet goes to open Seward's chambers and nods her head. She opens the curtain to Seward's chambers and stands there with her mouth open for a few moments, then closes the curtain]

[noticing Dracula standing there]
Hello, can I help you sir?

[mimicking her]
Can I help you sir?
What's wrong with you, why did you not tell him?
Never mind! I vill tell him myself. And for your miserable performance, you will receive no tip!
Count Dracula. Hmm, curious. Are you descended from Vlad Tepes? The first Dracula?
cutting off their hands and feet, gouging out their eyes and then impaling them on iron spikes!
[after Van Helsing and Johnanthan have returned from driving a stake through Lucy's heart]
I don't understand it! he's covered in blood and there's not a drop on you!
I have been to many stakings- you have to know where to stand! You know, everything in life is location, location, location...
Are you saying that Count Dracula is our vampire?
I'm saying no. But I'm leeeeaning towards yes.
The theory of Yes- or no.
[draws a smiley face in the ashes]
There... you're starting to look like your old self again!

[examining Lucy's throat with a magnifying lens]
Three tiny puncture Marks on her Throat...

[breathes on and polishes the lens]
Two. Two tiny Puncture marks on her throat.

[as the two Vampire brides climb into his bed]
Whatare you on about? What's all this then? Who are you people? I-I'll have you know that's my knee your Straddiling!

[they start to gyrate on top of him]
No, Stop! Stop it at once! Oh! Ah... No, no this is wrong! This is wrong! This is wrong, do you hear me, wrong! this is-
WRONG ME! WRONG ME! WRONG MY BRAINS OUT!
Count Dracula, allow me to introduce Professor Abraham Van Helsing of London University. He's a doctor of rare diseases as well as theology and philosophy.
Oh, I didn't know you had your hand in that, too.
Yes, I'm schh-eduled to meet Count Dracula.

[upon seeing two voluptuous vampire women - one rubbing a table seductively, the other rubbing the bedpost seductively]
My God! What on earth are you doing to the furniture?

[throwing Renfield back into his cell]
You'll stay in here 'til you rot!

[Renfield starts sobbing and Martin comes in a second later]
Well, you're free to go!
But I've only been here for a moment.
For that moment, you were very good.

[having been told to drive a stake into Lucy]
Oh, that's horrible. Is there no other way?
One other. We could cut off her head, stuff her mouth with garlic and tear off her ears!

[after a moment's thought]
Give me the stake.
No. No, I can't do it... you do it!
It must be done by one who loved her in life!
[Jonathan had just impaled Lucy, and was hit by two rounds of blood]
Oh! This is - this is ghastly!
Yes, you're right. We should have put newspapers down!
Why don't we have a look at the brain?
First we crack open the skull, like so.
[bashes the corpse's head with a big hammer]
Behold the naked human brain... Examine it!
Where did her blood go? There's nothing on the pillow case, or her nightgown.

[Renfield has been caught peeping at Lucy, and is being thrown back into the Asylum]
I didn't see anything! I didn't see anything!

[Orderly who threw him in the cell leaves]
I saw everything.

[in a dream walking about in the daylight thinking it's real]
Everything is so lovely and colorful, and the sun is so shiny!
[He spots two lovers having a picnic]
Say there, I just can't help that it is so lovely out here today, but if I could just spare it for a piece of your... chicken?
Oh what the hell, let me try it.

[Happy to see him]
Renfield, look at me! I'm drinking wine, and eating chicken!
Master, what are you doing out in the daytime?

[realizing the smoke]
I... made... a mistake... I've got to get back to my coffin!
[He wakes up in panic noticing the dark out the window then, calms down]
It is night time, so it wasn't real, I was having... a daymare.
Children of the night... What a mess they make.
[still at the breakfast scene. A grasshopper jumps onto the patio. Renfield, intentionally, throws his fork]
[Renfield gets on all fours and scrambles under the table for the insect]
Mr. Renfield, what are you doing down there?
[the grasshopper's leg is sticking out of Renfield's mouth, and wiggling about. Renfield looks at Dr. Seward, confused]
My God, man! You're eating insects right from the ground!
I can see one trying to get out of your mouth!
Yes, out of your mouth! Your very own mouth and it's wiggling about!
I'm not ridiculous at all! It's wiggling all over the place! Poor thing is fighting for its life!
[Renfield eyes the grasshopper's leg, and quickly scoops it up]
I don't know what you're talking about. If you insist on ranting like this, I'm going to leave!
[grabs the air in attempt to catch the fly]
I won't hurt you! All I want is your life!
[Renfield does a body slam across Dr. Seward's lap, and knocks everything off the table]
[Renfield is having breakfast with Dr. Seward. He sees a bug on the table and eats it]
I was just telling Ma... what was that?
You just grabbed something from the table.
Yes you did, I saw you, you put it in your mouth. I think it was an insect.

[thinks of an alibi]
Oh, that was a raspberry.
Then it must have been a raisin. I guess it fell off the muffin. See? There's one missing.
[the two men laugh. Renfield sees a spider coming towards him, and he quickly eats it up]
How silly of me! It must have been my imagina... there, you did it again!
You just put a bug in your mouth. I think it was a spider!
[this goes on for two and a half rounds]

[shouts]
I tell you I saw you snatch a spider right of the air and eat it!
[after becoming a vampire, Lucy comes on to Jonathan]
I know you've always wanted me, and I've always wanted you. Finally we can be together.
But Lucy, I'm engaged to Mina... and you're dead.

[carrying Essie out instead of Mina]
You will be my bride throughout eternity. We'll share the endless passion of immortal love.

[stares at her in surprise]
NOT YOU!

[takes her back inside and throws heron the floor, and carries Mina out, speaking very fast]
You will be my bride throughout eternity, we'll share the endless passion of immortal love!
Renfield, you were having a nightmare!
A nightmare? But it was so real, so vivid. Two voluptuous women; grinding, heaving. I don't know how to describe it...
Have you ever been to Paris?

[after rising from his coffin and hitting his head on a chandelier]
I must move the coffin or the chandelier.
[Johnathon drives a stake into Lucy's heart and is subsequently hit by many gallons of blood]
Oh... my... GOD! There's so much blood!
She just ate! Hit her again!
How much blood can she have left?
[Jonathan hits the stake again and is hit with even more blood than last time]

[as the vampire women are seducing Renfield]
"Wrong me! Wrong me! Wrong me!"
Are you saying that Count Dracula is our vampire?
I'm saying no. But I'm leeeeaning towards yes.
The theory of Yes- or no.

[to Martin, about Renfield]
Put him in a straitjacket and give him an enema! Wait, give him an enema FIRST, then put him in a straitjacket!

[after flying out the window to the ground below]
Time for you to join me! Come, Renfield.
[Renfield obeys and dives out the window, crash-landing on the ground below, then staggers disoriented to his feet]

[Hobbles in pain]
Yes, Master... Yes... Ohhhh!
Renfield... I meant for you to use the drainpipe
Yes, master... You fly... I don't... Yes, yes...
Would you care for some wine?
I never drink wine... oh, what the hell. Let me try it.

[waking up from a bad dream]
Oh, it's night-time. I was having a daymare.
[Dracula picks up Jonathan by the throat]

Arrogant mortal! You are in my world now and you will never leave this attic alive! I will destroy you, and then I will possess she whom you love the most. And there is not a single thing in the world you can do to stop me!
[Dracula laughs. Jonathan pokes him in the eyes and Dracula drops Jonathan]

[watching Mina's reflection in a mirror as she's dancing with Dracula, where it looks like she's dancing alone]
She's doing quite well without him, isn't she?
Oh it makes me so happy to be at the Opera! I love this palace of art and beauty!
Oh yes my dear, the Opera is astonishing! The music is frothed with love, hate, sensuality and unbridled passion!... All the things in my life I've managed to suppress so far.
Master! Master!... I mean... Mister! Mister!

[after Dr.Steward catches Jonathan with his hands on Mina's behind]
Without any reason, he put his hands on me!

[exasperate]
But she told me to touch it!
